base: Mobile operations (Western Egypt/Libya retreat zone, October-December 1942)

operations_history.mission_type: ground - aircraft damaged by fighter-bomber raid

operations_history.operation: Destruction of unserviceable aircraft at abandoned airfields
operations_history.mission_type: ground - aircraft destroyed to prevent capture

sources: Air War Publications - Wüstennotstaffel Part One
Air War Publications - Wüstennotstaffel Part Two
Key Aero - How the Luftwaffe rescued downed airmen in North Africa
metadata.notes: Unit transitioned from rescue operations to courier/transport duties during Q4 1942 retreat from El Alamein. Aircraft strength degraded by British raids and deliberate destruction during retreat. Commander Oblt Heinz Ebert succeeded Hptm Heinz Kroseberg (KIA May 12, 1942). Specific aircraft counts estimated based on typical staffel strength (9 aircraft at full strength in October 1941) and documented losses/damage during retreat. Unit relocated frequently during retreat from Egypt through Libya toward Tunisia. By end of Q4 1942, unit was approaching Tunisian border.
